alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 2:24PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cherokee and southeastern Bartow Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 224 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near George Washington Carver State Park, or 8 miles east of Cartersville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, pea sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cartersville, Woodstock, Emerson, Little River Landing, George Washington Carver St Pk, Kellogg Creek, Red Top Mountain State Park, Oak Grove, Hobgood Park, and Bridgemill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
